title: Flow cytometric analysis of phosphatidylcholine metabolism using organelle-selective click labeling

Step-by-step method details
Metabolic incorporation of N3-Cho
Timing: 1 h
This section describes the metabolic incorporation of N3-Cho into PC in the K562 cells (Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]).
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/2947-Fig1.jpg
Figure 1. Scheme for metabolic N3-Cho incorporation and fluorescent PC labeling
Steps 1–11 for metabolic incorporation of N3-Cho into PC in K562 cells. Steps 12–21 for PC labeling in ER-Golgi using BDP-DBCO. Steps 22–32 for PC labeling in the plasma membrane using DBCO-AF647. Steps 33–49 for PC labeling in mitochondria using Cy3-DBCO.
Note: All steps are performed at room temperature otherwise indicated.
Maintain K562 cells in the culturing medium in a 10-cm dish in humidified incubator at 37°C, 5% CO2.
Transfer the cells into 15 mL conical tube.
Centrifuge at 500 × g, 3 min, and discard supernatant.
Resuspend with 5 mL of Cho-free medium.
Repeat step 3–4 once again.
Resuspend cells with 1 mL of Cho-free medium.
Critical: Wash the cells with choline-free medium 2–3 times to completely remove choline residues.
Cell count with automated cell counter.
Adjust cell density to 0.5–1.0 × 106 cells/mL with Cho-free medium.
Add 10 mM N3-Cho to final concentration of 10 μM. Mix well.
Inoculate the cell suspension into 12-well plate (1 mL/well).
Culture cells in humidified incubator at 37°C, 5% CO2 for 16–24 h.
Note: At this point, the protocols diverge depending on the target of the interest (ER-Golgi, Plasma membrane or mitochondria). Choose one of the methods below to continue the protocol at step 12 for ER-Golgi, step 22 for plasma membrane, or step 33 for mitochondria.
Organelle-specific labeling of N3-PC
Labeling of N3-PC in the ER-Golgi
Timing: 45 min
This section describes the fluorescence labeling of N3-PC using the ER-Golgi-targeting clickable dye BDP-DBCO (Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]).
Note: 12–21 steps are performed at room temperature.

Transfer 200 μL of the cell suspension into 1.5 mL tube.
Centrifuge at 1000 × g, 1 min. Discard the supernatant.
Resuspend with 500 μL of 4% FBS/IMDM.
Repeat step 13–14 again.
Centrifuge at 1000 × g, 1 min. Discard the supernatant.
Resuspend cells with 500 μL of BDP-DBCO working solution. Mix well by pipetting 3–4 times, then incubate at room temperature for 15 min.
Optional: 1 μL of FVD780 can be added to assess cell viability.
Critical: It is important to make cells dispersed during click chemistry reaction.
Centrifuge at 1000 × g for 1 min, discard the supernatant, and resuspend with 1 mL of 10% FBS/IMDM.
Repeat step 18 once more.
Resuspend the cells with 500 μL of 10% FBS/IMDM.
Filter the cells through 40 μm nylon cell strainer into 5 mL polystyrene tube.
Note: Fluorophore used in this study is relatively stable, and thus filtered cells can be stored at room temperature for up to 8 h without reducing the fluorescence signals. However, it is recommended to analyze the cells as quickly as possible.
(Continued to step 50).
Labeling of N3-PC at the plasma membrane
Timing: 1 h
This section describes the fluorescence labeling of N3-PC using the plasma membrane-targeting clickable dye DBCO-AF647 (Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]).
Note: 22–27 steps are performed at 15°C. 28–32 steps are performed at 4°C or on ice.
Transfer 200 μL of the cell suspension into 1.5 mL tube.
Centrifuge at 1000 × g, 1 min. Discard the supernatant.
Resuspend with 500 μL of 4% FBS/IMDM.
Repeat step 23–24 again.
Centrifuge at 1000 × g, 1 min. Discard the supernatant.
Resuspend cells with 100 μL of DBCO-AF647 working solution. Mix well by pipetting 3–4 times, then incubate at 15°C for 30 min.
Optional: 1 μL of FVD780 can be added to assess cell viability.

Critical: It is important to make cells dispersed during click chemistry reaction.
Centrifuge at 1000 × g for 1 min, discard the supernatant, and resuspend with 1 mL of ice-cold 10% FBS/IMDM.
Repeat step 28 once more.
Centrifuge at 1000 × g for 1 min. Discard the supernatant
Resuspend with 500 μL of ice-cold 10% FBS/IMDM.
Filter the cells through 40 μm nylon cell strainer into 5 mL polystyrene tube.
Note: Fluorophore used in this study is relatively stable, and thus filtered cells can be stored at room temperature for up to 8 h without reducing the fluorescence signals. However, it is recommended to analyze the cells as quickly as possible.
(Continued to step 50).
Labeling of N3-PC in mitochondria
Timing: 2 h
This section describes the fluorescence labeling of N3-PC using the mitochondria-targeting clickable dye Cy3-DBCO (Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]).
Note: Steps 38, 40, 42, and 45 are performed at 37°C. The other steps are performed at room temperature.
Transfer 200 μL of the cell suspension into 1.5 mL tube.
Centrifuge at 1000 × g, 1 min. Discard the supernatant.
Resuspend with 500 μL of 4% FBS/IMDM.
Repeat step 34–35 again.
Centrifuge at 1000 × g, 1 min. Discard the supernatant.
Resuspend cells with 200 μL of warm Cy3-DBCO working solution. Mix well by pipetting 3–4 times, then incubate at 37°C for 15 min.
Optional: 1 μL of FVD780 can be added to assess cell viability.
Critical: It is important to make cells dispersed during click chemistry reaction.
Centrifuge at 1000 × g for 1 min. Discard supernatant.
Resuspend cells with 200 μL of warm Cy5-N3 working solution. Mix well by pipetting 3–4 times, then incubate at 37°C for 15 min.
Centrifuge at 1000 × g for 1 min. Discard supernatant.

Resuspend cells with 500 μL of warm High K + Washing Medium (Working). Mix well by pipetting 3–4 times, then incubate at 37°C for 15 min.
Repeat Steps 41–42 twice more.
Centrifuge at 1000 × g for 1 min. Discard supernatant.
Resuspend cells with 500 μL of warm 10% FBS/IMDM. Mix well by pipetting 3–4 times, then incubate at 37°C for 15 min.
Repeat Steps 44–45 twice more.
Centrifuge at 1000 × g for 1 min. Discard supernatant.
Resuspend the cells with 500 μL of 10% FBS/IMDM.
Filter the cells through 40 μm nylon cell strainer into 5 mL polystyrene tube.
Note: Fluorophore used in this study is relatively stable, and thus filtered cells can be stored at room temperature for up to 8 h without reducing the fluorescence signals. However, it is recommended to analyze the cells as quickly as possible.
Flow cytometry
Timing: 1 h
This section describes the gating strategy for optimal data acquisition (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]).
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/2947-Fig2.jpg
Figure 2. Flow cytometric analysis of labeled PC
(A) FSC-A and BSC-A dot plot for exclusion of cell debris.
(B) FSC-H and FSC-W dot plot for selection of singlet cells.
(C) Histograms showing cell viability of N3-Cho-treated cells labelled with AF647-DBCO (top), BDP-DBCO (middle) and Cy3-DBCO (bottom).
(D) Histograms showing untreated cells (blue) and N3-Cho-treated cells (red) which experienced PC labeling with AF647-DBCO (top), BDP-DBCO (middle) and Cy3-DBCO (bottom).
Optimize the flow cytometry instrument setting for optimal data acquisition. If using MA900 (Sony), following parameter can be used as a reference.
table:files/protocols_protocol_2947_5.csv
Scatter density plot (FSC-A vs. BSC-A, all events) (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]A): Set up a plot for FSC vs. BSC area to identify cells of interest.

Note: For K562 cells, typically live cells lie within the range of 20–70 (×10,000) in FSC-A and 10–40 (×10,000) in BSC-A (Gate A). Events with <20 (×10,000) in FSC-A are either debris or dead cells and should be gated out. Any events that lie >70 (×10,000) in FSC-A and >40 (×10,000) in BSC-A are likely non-singlets and should be avoided.
Scatter density plot (FSC-H vs. FSC-W, gate A) (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]B): Set up a plot for FSC-H vs. FSC-W to exclude doublet.
Note: Doublet cells can significantly affect your analysis and could lead to inaccurate conclusion. Gate for an area where majority (90%–100%) of events reside (Gate B).
Optional: Live cells can be selected by FVD780-negative staining (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]C).
Analysis of fluorescent-labelled PC (Fluorescence vs. Events, gate C) (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]D): set up a histogram plot for each organelle-selectively fluorescent-labelled PC to analyze its distribution.
For analyzing BDP-labeled PC, set up a histogram plot in the green fluorescence channel (FL1 vs. Events for MA900; Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]D middle).
For analyzing abundance of AF647-labeled PC, set up a histogram plot in the far-red fluorescence channel (FL10 vs. Events for MA900; Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]D top).
For analyzing Cy3-labeled PC, set up a histogram plot in the orange fluorescence channel (FL2 vs. Events for MA900; Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]D bottom).
